channel.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
channel.description:
Basically I got a trojan and had to deactivate some things at start up! When im in msconfig it shows where it is located in the Regestry and I want to delete it, but when i look at the Entry its not there.
I have already deactived it but I would rather it deleted it from the whole list just in case.
Any help?

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

In that pic you extended Windows instead of Windows NT.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:6, topic:258076”]Steps:

  1. Turn off System Restore
  2. Restart windows in safemode with command prompt
  3. Scan for virus / spy
  4. remove all infections
  5. restart computer, congratulations, tis now fix’d.

p.s. dont forget to turn on sys restore when u have fixed all.[/quote]
I have already removed the Trojan dlls and System Restored but the Regestry Values created have not been removed for some strange reason.

Its bikuhagu, dewulale and vutofudi that are annoying me. I am definatly at the Entry becuase there are not any any subfolders.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Steps:

  1. Turn off System Restore
  2. Restart windows in safemode with command prompt
  3. Scan for virus / spy
  4. remove all infections
  5. restart computer, congratulations, tis now fix’d.

p.s. dont forget to turn on sys restore when u have fixed all.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Just widen up the Startup Item/Command/Location tabs and scroll along, it’s what I always do.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Attiusca, post:2, topic:258076”]Are you sure you are looking in the write root? Alot of them are similar and it can get confusing,

In msconfig, try to expand the field where it shows the registry path and read the entire thing.[/quote]

I am in ROOT and i Cant Extend the Msconfig window

Does a Picture Help?

By the way its the the 3 than run in “rundll32”

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

perhaps try downloading HiJackThis
might help

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting System Regestry Values
item.dc:creator: @Attiusca Attiusca
item.description:
@Attiusca wrote:

Are you sure you are looking in the write root? Alot of them are similar and it can get confusing,

In msconfig, try to expand the field where it shows the registry path and read the entire thing.

Read full topic
